intro: Erodium petraeum proles celtibericum, commonly known as the Celtiberian rock eryngo, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically thrives in rocky or limestone soils, often found in Mediterranean regions. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate, with a distinctive scent when crushed. This species is of particular interest in botanical studies due to its historical and ecological significance in the Iberian Peninsula.
